hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition on Regulatory News Shock
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, negative regulatory news (MiCA enforcement, exchange actions) causing > 5% BTC drop on > 2x volume will trigger BEAR regime within 2 days with 80% probability if combined with futures open interest decline > 15%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional bias, making them vulnerable to exogenous shocks. Regulatory news triggers deleveraging (OI drop) and sentiment shifts that persist beyond initial reaction.
entry_conditions: Major negative regulatory news (Bloomberg Crypto Regulatory Index spike > 20%)
BTC drops > 5% within 4 hours of news
Aggregate futures open interest declines > 15% within 24 hours
Perpetual funding rates turn negative (< -0.02% daily)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime confirms BEAR (confidence > 70%) OR 6% gain from short entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC recovers > 50% of news-driven drop within 24 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 65% of such news shocks produce sustained BEAR regimes OR markets recover > 75% of drop within 3 days
